title: How do I ward effectively as mid and support?
body:
I main Xerath and use my global ranged ult often (but not necessarily effectively), but I rarely know where to ward in mid lane, there's a whole lot of guides in _general_ warding for _support_, but not a lot on Xerath and/or mid.

Should I take ruby sightstone over individual wards? How do I use pink wards effectively, all the places I ward are bushes the opponent enters often, or are not in bushes at all.

9 out of 10 deaths I have when playing mid are from ganks rather than from a laner I'm up against (unless that laner is {{champion:7}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:7}} )

When playing supp, should I ward to help my ult more (Which leads to my ADC snowballing from farming without any opposition), or should I ward defensively for my ADC?

replies.body:
Ward where you think you would go if you were them and they were you. 
Warding is mind games. You can ward the lonely river brush as well.

I tried this once... The enemy Rammus wouldn't stop buying as much oracles as he could just to destroy _one_ ward I placed with a sightstone. He still got fed and my attempts to waste his gold were in vain.

I don't have much places to put a pink ward when midlaning, every single bush around mid lane (DW Chuffer's post has one pink ward spot, but it's bottom lane and too far for me to use effectively) is used by the jungler to gank me, even the lonely bush in the river.

> [{quoted}](name=kJs,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Ltxy0iod,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-06-13T15:27:03.481+0000)
>
> Ward where you think you would go if you were them and they were you. 
> Warding is mind games. You can ward the lonely river brush as well.

Basically this but I'd like to expand on it. 

Warding is basically vision where you place vision on where you need it most thus this will depend on the champion compositions and blue/purple side. If they have a early game ganker like Lee Sin you should ward the route they will most likely take as soon as it's 3-4 minutes. That's the time zone they will most likely gank. This is usually Tri + River at bot and top lane; and usually the slopes that lead towards the river (Raptors or Blue Buff). You need to ward further in when they have an Eve for example. Remember to always purchase a pink ward if that's the case and place it behind you. This way a lane gank + flank will be impossible to execute. Just remember the strengths and weaknesses of the jungler and ward accordingly.

I like to tell support mains that deep wards are really crucial if you want to gain an edge on the game. After your first back you should either have a sightstone or mobility boots. If you have mobility boots you can easily get into their jungle but you will not have many wards to spare. Its always wise to pick up 2 pink wards anytime you can because they provide the best vision (being infinite and detectable). 
I'll post up a picture that details the best spots to ward as blue and purple side supports.

As you can see, if you ward these spots, not only will you have complete vision of half their jungle which will give you the perfect idea of where the jungler is headed, you will have effectively warded for mid lane and even top lane (If they see the jungler is bottom side, they can't possibly gank top). I included a pink(red) ward to  show you a good spot to ward for pink as its usually not checked. You can change the mid lane side brush on purple with a pink because that is rarely checked!

The problem with deep warding is that sometimes it's too risky to get there for most squishy supports.
In that situation, a walking nuclear arsenal with a ward in his hand might be a really appreciated help.
Or you could just be Taric, and walk fabulously trough enemy fire like a gem-covered DiCaprio.
{{champion:44}}
you can pink ward the river on one side and buy a ward for the other, or go for the more risky use trinket on one side and hug that side. Be sure to upgrade your trinket past lvl 8.

As a support, it'd be a very long explanation. I was thinking a few days ago to start writing something, like a collection of hints and tips, but it just got tooo much.
As a mage, a good starting point would be to get the upgraded yellow trinket ({{item:3361}}) and _ask your support_ where he wants more vision.
Really, if he's worth anything he'll have at least a few spots in mind that he can't reach right then, and he'll hugely appreciate the help.
Might even move some other guy to place one or two. Y'know, to show off.
I actually take blue trinket so I can finish off whoever runs with really low health, it's actually done more than what yellow has provided me with, now that I buy sightstone or a ton of wards

Well, if you get sightstone or tons of wards, yellow trinket has no advantage. I just suggested it as the most cost-effective and less item-cluttering way of helping. Also, only way to ward in very late game. But by all means feel free to get greens and pinks.
I often get {{item:3362}} over {{item:3361}} for vision control and vision denial. You can bait out a lot of people for it as well, free harass etc.
